text: “Alex wakes to a hissing sound and a growing puddle. The radiator has burst
moneyMin: spraying rusty water across the floor. The landlord’s number goes straight to voicemail.”

text: “The text arrives without warning: ‘I got the job—I’m moving across the country next week.’ A close friend
moneyMin: suddenly gone. The apartment feels quieter already.”

text: “The check engine light has been on for weeks
moneyMin: but now the car won’t start at all. The tow truck driver shakes their head knowingly. This is going to hurt.”

text: “Alex’s beloved childhood dog crosses the rainbow bridge after a long
moneyMin: good life. The vet is kind
happinessMin: but the house feels unbearably empty.”

text: “An unexpected tax bill arrives in the mail. Apparently Alex miscalculated something last year
moneyMin: and the IRS would like to discuss it. With penalties.”

text: “The upstairs neighbor’s bathtub overflows in the middle of the night
moneyMin: creating a waterfall through Alex’s ceiling. The landlord promises to fix it ‘eventually.’”

text: “Alex’s favorite coffee shop—the one with the perfect corner booth and the barista who knows their order—is closing permanently. A chain store is moving in.”
“Someone breaks into Alex’s car and steals the stereo
moneyMin: leaving shattered glass on the driver’s seat. Nothing else was taken
moneyMax: just the one thing that made commutes bearable.”

text: “The promotion Alex was promised goes to someone else—someone newer
moneyMin: with better connections. The explanation is corporate speak for ‘sorry

text: “A family member calls with bad news about a health diagnosis. Everything else suddenly feels trivial and far away.”
“The landlord announces a rent increase that’s technically legal but practically devastating. Alex has 60 days to decide: pay more or move.”
“Alex’s bike gets hit by a car while parked. The driver didn’t leave a note
moneyMin: just a crumpled frame and bent wheels.”

text: “A beloved pet gets sick suddenly. The emergency vet saves their life
moneyMin: but Alex’s savings account takes a critical hit.”

text: “The company announces layoffs. Alex survives the cut
moneyMin: but three close work friends don’t. Survivor’s guilt sets in during the awkward goodbye drinks.”

text: “Someone steals Alex’s package from the porch—the one with the birthday gift for their sibling. No insurance
“The power goes out during a heatwave
moneyMin: and everything in the fridge spoils before the electricity comes back. The smell is unforgettable.”

text: “Alex discovers their identity was used to open a credit card. Hours on hold with fraud departments and credit bureaus follow.”
“A long-term relationship ends not with drama but with a tired conversation about growing apart. It’s mutual
“The favorite local bookstore where Alex spent countless hours announces it’s closing. Another community space lost to rising rents.”
“A work project Alex poured months into gets cancelled due to ‘shifting priorities.’ All that effort
